summary:
The Security Council:

* Endorses the Secretary-General's proposal to deploy additional military observers to monitor and verify the ceasefire and disengagement plans (para 4).
* Invites the Secretary-General to organize a follow-up meeting between the Lusaka Ceasefire Agreement signatories and the Security Council members (para 5).
* Requests the Secretary-General to review MONUC's current mandate and provide proposals on addressing the situation in eastern provinces, including areas bordering Rwanda, Uganda, and Burundi (paras 6-7).
* Expresses readiness to support the deployment of infantry units in support of military observers (para 8).
* Requests the Secretary-General to propose a permanent follow-up mechanism to address issues such as foreign forces' withdrawal, disarmament, and refugees' return (para 9).
* Calls for the withdrawal of Ugandan and Rwandan forces and other foreign forces from the Democratic Republic of Congo (para 10).
* Calls on parties to cooperate in disarmament, demobilization, reintegration, and repatriation of armed groups (para 11).
* Urges parties to cooperate in the inter-Congolese dialogue (para 12).
* Reiterates the call to prevent human rights abuses and ensure humanitarian personnel's access (para 13).
* Demands the demobilization and rehabilitation of children recruited by armed forces and groups (para 14).
* Stresses the need to strengthen MONUC's human rights component (para 15).
* Calls on parties to cooperate with the expert panel on the illegal exploitation of natural resources (para 16).
* Calls on parties to fully implement their commitments under the Lusaka Ceasefire Agreement (para 17).
* Expresses readiness to consider measures against parties that fail to comply with this resolution (para 18).
* Decides to remain actively seized of the matter (para 19).
